articles.author: Developer DAO (🧱, 🚀)
articles.description:
Who built something LIT lately? 🔥

Patrick Skinner (🧱, 🚀): #30daysoftext @developer_dao 
@LitProtocol is not a protocol to sleep on. 
It's a decentralized key management network, changing how we approach dApp security, data privacy, and user autonomy in Web3. Here's why it's my favorite... 
👇👇
(1/8)
articles.title: Who built something LIT lately? 🔥

articles.author: Developer DAO (🧱, 🚀)
articles.description:
Re @PSkinnerTech knows something about wallets!
... his AI game is on point too 👀

Patrick Skinner (🧱, 🚀): 🚀 Let's dive into why setting up token allowances with @zerion Wallet is crucial for your Web3 security. 
First off, what's a token allowance? It's your permission for a dApp to use your tokens - a standard feature of ERC-20 tokens.
#30daysoftext @developer_dao 
(1/8)
articles.title: Re @PSkinnerTech knows something about wallets! ... his AI game is on point too 👀

articles.description:

articles.description:
There is still time left to tell @POKTnetwork what open-source libraries web3 is missing! 🤔
Do you have a long-standing problem, or just a good idea? 
Let them know and you got the chance to win $100 worth of POKT tokens! 💸
#30daysoftext

Developer DAO (🧱, 🚀): #30daysoftext Day 6
Another one for our partners, this time with a bounty! 🤑
What open-source libraries would you like @POKTnetwork to build? 🏗
The winner gets 100 USD worth of POKT tokens 💸
Make sure to tag @POKTnetwork, so they can find it 🤫

articles.author: Developer DAO (🧱, 🚀)
articles.description:
Re @Jamiescript thinks the web3 ecosystem needs better identity management solutions.
Do you think that's the case or are there more pressing issues that @POKTnetwork could solve with an open-source library?

Jamiebones: #30daysoftext Day 6
@POKTnetwork should consider building and open-sourcing a Decentralized Identity Management System (DIMS) built upon Pokt's robust infrastructure. It's like OAuth but for Web3 and completely decentralized.
articles.title: Re @Jamiescript thinks the web3 ecosystem needs better identity management solutions. Do you think that's the case or are there more pressing issues t...

articles.author: Developer DAO (🧱, 🚀)
articles.description:
Re @CuriousRabeet seems concerned about security in the ecosystem and wishes for a security audit toolkit.
What do you think?
#30daysoftext

Syed Rabeet: #30daysoftext Day 6 @developer_dao 
I would like @POKTnetwork to build an open-source security audit toolkit related to smart contracts and applications. This toolkit can include best practices and guidelines to ensure the security of the applications built on the network.
articles.title: Re @CuriousRabeet seems concerned about security in the ecosystem and wishes for a security audit toolkit. What do you think? #30daysoftext

articles.author: Developer DAO (🧱, 🚀)
articles.description:
RT Jamiebones
#30daysoftext
Smart contracts face a limitation in that they cannot directly access external data sources outside their blockchain environment. This gap is addressed by oracles, which serve to connect smart contracts with external data sources.
articles.title: RT Jamiebones: #30daysoftext Smart contracts face a limitation in that they cannot directly access external data sources outside their blockchain envi...

articles.author: Developer DAO (🧱, 🚀)
articles.description:
RT Sardius
As a developer, why should you care about oracles when writing smart contracts?
Smart contracts face a critical limitation - they can't interact with data outside the blockchain they run on
Oracles aim to solve this problem, enabling dApps fusing on and offchain data
🧵👇 /7

Developer DAO (🧱, 🚀): #30daysoftext Day 5
Explain the role of oracles in smart contracts 🔮 
It can be a short article, a Twitter thread, or even just a tweet. Just ensure to explain it well.
Reply with a link to the text, so we can find it 🤫
articles.title: RT Sardius: As a developer, why should you care about oracles when writing smart contracts? Smart contracts face a critical limitation - they can't in...

articles.description:

Blockchains are liked walled gardens, only caring about what goes on inside their respective chain.
